info.title: idocs api document
info.description:
Alipay uses the notifySubscription interface to send the subscription result to the merchant when the subscription creation reaches a final state of success or failure. 

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º

  • Request header
  • Response header

Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20".
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".
info.descriptionLake:
Alipay uses the notifySubscription interface to send the subscription result to the merchant when the subscription creation reaches a final state of success or failure. 

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º

  • Request header
  • Response header

Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20".
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".

subscriptionRequestId.description: The unique ID assigned by a merchant to identify a subscription request.
subscriptionRequestId.descriptionLake: The unique ID assigned by a merchant to identify a subscription request.

subscriptionId.description: The unique ID assigned by Alipay to identify a subscription.
subscriptionId.descriptionLake: The unique ID assigned by Alipay to identify a subscription.

subscriptionStatus.description:
The subscription status. Valid values are:

  • ACTIVE: indicates that the subscription becomes active. 
  • TERMINATED: indicates that the subscription is terminated.
subscriptionStatus.descriptionLake:
The subscription status. Valid values are:

  • ACTIVE: indicates that the subscription becomes active. 
  • TERMINATED: indicates that the subscription is terminated.

subscriptionNotificationType.description:
The notification type about the subscription. 

  • CREATE: indicates that the subscription was created. 
  • CHANGE: indicates that the subscription was changed. 
  • CANCEL: indicates that the subscription is canceled and the service is not provided after the current subscription period ends. 
  • TERMINATE: indicates that the subscription is terminated and the service is not provided.
subscriptionNotificationType.descriptionLake:
The notification type about the subscription. 

  • CREATE: indicates that the subscription was created. 
  • CHANGE: indicates that the subscription was changed. 
  • CANCEL: indicates that the subscription is canceled and the service is not provided after the current subscription period ends. 
  • TERMINATE: indicates that the subscription is terminated and the service is not provided.

subscriptionStartTime.description: The date and time when the subscription becomes active.
subscriptionStartTime.descriptionLake: The date and time when the subscription becomes active.

subscriptionEndTime.description: The date and time when the subscription ends.
subscriptionEndTime.descriptionLake: The date and time when the subscription ends.

periodType.description:
The subscription period type. Valid values are:

  • YEAR: indicates that the subscription period is measured in years. 
  • MONTH: indicates that the subscription period is measured in months. 
  • WEEK: indicates that the subscription period is measured in weeks. 
  • DAY: indicates that the subscription period is measured in days.
periodType.descriptionLake:
The subscription period type. Valid values are:

  • YEAR: indicates that the subscription period is measured in years. 
  • MONTH: indicates that the subscription period is measured in months. 
  • WEEK: indicates that the subscription period is measured in weeks. 
  • DAY: indicates that the subscription period is measured in days.

periodCount.description: The number of period types within one subscription period. For example, if the value of periodType is MONTH and the value of periodCount is 2, it means that the subscription period is two months.
periodCount.descriptionLake: The number of period types within one subscription period. For example, if the value of periodType is MONTH and the value of periodCount is 2, it means that the subscription period is two months.

periodRule.description: The subscription period rule, used to define a subscription's billing period.
periodRule.descriptionLake: The subscription period rule, used to define a subscription's billing period.

resultCode.description: The value is fixed as SUCCESS.
resultCode.descriptionLake: The value is fixed as SUCCESS.

resultStatus.description: The value is fixed as S.
resultStatus.descriptionLake: The value is fixed as S.

resultMessage.description: The value is fixed as success.
resultMessage.descriptionLake: The value is fixed as success.

result.description: A fixed value, which is sent to Alipay to acknowledge that the notification is received.
result.descriptionLake: A fixed value, which is sent to Alipay to acknowledge that the notification is received.

post.x-more:
Result process logic

Send the following message with fixed values to Alipay after receiving the notification, to acknowledge that the notification from Alipay is received:

{
 "result": {
    "resultCode":"SUCCESS",
    "resultStatus":"S",
    "resultMessage":"success"
 }
}

If no such message is returned to Alipay due to operation issues or network issues, Alipay automatically resends the notification up to eight times within 24 hours or until the correct response is received. The sending intervals are as follows: 0 sec, 2 min, 10 min, 10 min, 1 h, 2 h, 6 h, and 15 h.
post.x-more-lake:
Result process logic

Send the following message with fixed values to Alipay after receiving the notification, to acknowledge that the notification from Alipay is received:

{
 "result": {
    "resultCode":"SUCCESS",
    "resultStatus":"S",
    "resultMessage":"success"
 }
}

If no such message is returned to Alipay due to operation issues or network issues, Alipay automatically resends the notification up to eight times within 24 hours or until the correct response is received. The sending intervals are as follows: 0 sec, 2 min, 10 min, 10 min, 1 h, 2 h, 6 h, and 15 h.
